body: git error cause another commit involved

@armenatzoglou is it possible to preserve the original cherry-picked commit and add any additional modification on top of that? Going forward we will be porting many fixes from GPDB to HAWQ and it might be a good practice to preserve the authorship :-) That's also the way we port fixes from Postgres to GPDB, e.g.

LGTM
better to move decrease_planning_depth to the end of try
@0x0FFF the code is in, can you close this pull request? Thanks!

Looks the JIRA message is not the format recommended. Here is what is recommended. more details can be found at: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/HAWQ/Contributing+to+HAWQ

jira ticket number. Commit Message
Example: HAWQ-1002. Add awesome feature
@liming01 to merge this pull request. It is blocking the test. It is better to merge it asap.

@foyzur I see your point, but I do not think that this is possible for this PR. The reason is that this code comes from a commit three years ago. Unfortunately, in GPDB OSS there is no commits' history from back then. In particular, the history of the files changed in this PR starts from 10/23/2015 with a commit that squashes all previous ones. Consequently, those commits are not appropriate for this PR. Thanks
Thanks for the review. Closing the pull request and changes has been pushed in this commit f94b8194cb3ff12f61e8013d97a724f4f9ca9d54
@liming01 to review. it is related to your work on bucket number.
@foyzur I gave it a try to cherry-pick the changes from stash, but it is not possible, since they have different folder structure. I have added the hash of your commits in this PR.
@changleicn Please add the hash of GPDB commits (see first comment) in the final commit. thanks

I think it is better to improve this fix to update GRM availability of segments, currently, if a segment is FTS available, it is set in gp_segment_configuration as 'u' regardless the status of GRM availability, i.e. yarn availability. Can this fix include the following functions:
1) in not NONE mode, update gp_segment_configuration according to GRM availability as well, 
2) save the availability history in gp_segment_configuration caused by the changes of GRM availability.

Just to confirm: this new flag in the DML node is set in all cases when the input is sorted on partition id. By "all cases" I mean: 
- destination is AO table, and number of parts is > optimizer_parts_to_force_sort_on_insert
- destination is Parquet table and gp_parquet_insert_sort is true
- any other case when ORCA inserts a sort on partition id before the DML node

Correct?

Currently, only the first 2 cases will set the flag to true. no other case at this moment.

@vraghavan78
Only the first 2 case it is true. All other cases in false.
@radarwave and @changleicn, please also take a look at this PR, since this is bumping the JSON version from 0.6 to 0.12. Thanks.

In function calculate_virtual_segment_number , what if the former table has larger bucket num, but the latter table has smaller one? maxHashBucketNumber should be the larger value between  maxHashBucketNumber and  targetPolicy->bucketnum.
maxHashBucketNumber = targetPolicy->bucketnum;
I think it's better to put the code inside function SetupProcessIdentity, instead of putting it in the PostgresMain, since the function already takes up so many lines.
If I put the code into function SetupProcessIdentity, I must put serializedIdentityLen into the function which will change the function interface. So I just make the minimal change.
General question - does it also solve the problem for writable? I thought for writable tables the code path didn't pass through hd_work_mgr.
can you also check if you differentiate secure and non-secure queries - for non-secure query we don't need dfs_address info
Yet to explore the writable table path.
The dfs_address will not be required in the case of non-secure cluster. Will handle this once we update this to be passed via segment data as opposed to fragment data
Looks good. Do you plan to open a separate story for writable?
@radarwave Can you take a look at this PR?  Thanks!
+1 The code change is ok to me

'ip' command can be installed on the machine which have OSX<10.11, then we don't need to fix this.

Not quite sure now, but as my remember, ifconfig have some issues to get the ipv6 ip addresses on some old Mac OS. So we turned to use command 'ip'.

If you can test on the previous version OSX, then this PR is good to go. 

Thanks.

We don't run any of those OS versions here, but we can try to test it with Vagrant.  Alternatively, we can add the `ip` executable to the list of toolchain requirements (but I'd prefer the former).  @radarwave, what OSX version should we target for testing?
looks better to have a jira for this and remove the extra spaces.

LGTM. 
Verified this can fix generate yaml file. 

Would you please file a jira and update the commit message? Like below:

HAWQ-XXX. hawqextract column context does not exist error 

BTW, did you tested run with the generated yarm file? Thanks.
